resources.string:
The Bingo Game is a turn-based game in which there are two main entities: the players and the game host(caller).

Every player has a number n of cards, each of which contains 15 numbers which are spread over 3 rows and 9 columns.

Every turn starts with the caller stating a number from 1 to 90, and ends with each player ticking off the given number and eventually announcing and notifying the caller that a new score was reached.

Every type of score has to be reached sequentially, meaning that the second score cannot be touched unless a player achieved the first before.

The match ends once a player obtained the last score available, Bingo!
\nScores to be obtained in a Match

There are 5 types of scores:
 - Ambo, two numbers ticked off in a row
 - Terno, three numbers ticked off in a row
 - Quaterno, four numbers ticked off in a row
 - Cinquina, five numbers ticked off in a row
 - Bingo, the entire card was ticked off

Justifiably, the achievement of a score is impossible if no one achieved the previous score.

Note that if a player achieves a score, e.g ambo, another player has no more to announce that ambo was achieved but only that the next score, (i.e terno), was obtained.

In the case of this game, one player can choose the number of cards to play with.
Notice that a greater number of cards does not necessarily mean a greater win probability.

Good luck and enjoy the game!

This is what a bingo card looks like!
It is made of 3 rows and 9 columns. Besides that, a bingo card is characterized by two features:
 1. Every row must contain 5 numbers
 2. Every column must contain at least 1 number
